title: About KBG
mission: To promote interdisciplinary learning and innovation at the intersection of biology, engineering, and technology at IIT Mandi.
history: Kamand Bioengineering Group (KBG) was founded as an interdisciplinary student club to bridge the gap between life sciences and engineering. What began as a small initiative by a few enthusiasts has evolved into a vibrant community exploring everything from synthetic biology to bio-AI integration.
aboutLong: Kamand Bioengineering Group (KBG) is an official student club of IIT Mandi that brings together curious minds from across disciplines to explore the rapidly growing world of bioengineering. The club serves as a platform for students to learn, experiment, and innovate through hands-on projects, technical workshops, speaker sessions, and hackathons. Our focus areas span biotechnology, artificial intelligence, computational biology, biomimetics, bio-robotics, and environmental innovation. KBG strives to create an ecosystem that nurtures creativity, fosters research collaborations, and encourages responsible technological advancement in the life sciences.

features.title: Workshops
features.description: Hands-on technical sessions covering topics like bioinformatics, biosensing, biomimetic design, bio-AI integration, and computational modeling. These sessions are designed to equip students with practical, research-ready skills.

features.title: Projects
features.description: KBG supports interdisciplinary student-led projects combining biology with AI, electronics, and mechanical systems. Projects range from biosensing devices to optimization algorithms inspired by nature.

features.title: Speaker Sessions
features.description: Talks and interactions with researchers, innovators, and industry professionals who share insights into emerging trends and career paths in bioengineering and biotechnology.

features.title: Community Events
features.description: Interactive events, challenges, and hackathons like BioForge, AI+ series, and Cell Saga that encourage learning through creativity, teamwork, and real-world problem solving.

whatWeDo: Organize interdisciplinary workshops and training sessions
Host events and hackathons in bioengineering and AI
Promote hands-on student projects and innovation
Invite expert talks and mentorship sessions
Encourage open-source development in bio-tech fields
Collaborate with research labs and technical societies
Foster a creative community of bioengineers and makers
